    • Constructor Detail

      • Landscape

        public Landscape()
        Creates a default landscape of a size 100x120. The landscape tiling is based of a text file in the project folder, which contains the ordered list of tile names to be read. Plants are then randomly generated with moderate probability and general variety.

    • Method Detail

      • setDRate

        public void setDRate(double r)
        Sets landscape's disaster rate
        Parameters:
        r - represents the new disaster rate of the landscape

      • show

        public void show(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws the floor, animal, plant, and resources of each tile from the ground up in a grid formation. Each tile is a 10x10 square on the component object being drawn on; animals and plants are drawn larger for visibility.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object used to draw

      • populate

        public void populate(Animal animal)
        Populates the grid, tile by tile, with relatively low probability of populating an individual tile.
        Parameters:
        animal - Desired animal to populate the grid

      • populate

        public void populate()
        Populates the grid with a variety of animals that are equally probable.

      • makeInstructions

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> makeInstructions(Pair[][] vis,
                                                              int wantX,
                                                              int wantY)
        Creates a set of instructions for an animal to reach the desired object. The set appears as an ArrayList with the commands "up", "down", "left", or "right" to denote the direction in which the animal should move 1 index. Helper method for findResource and findAnimal for animals to determine optimal move sets.
        Parameters:
        vis - The array of coordinates of the optimal path to the desired animal or resource
        wantX - The desired x coordinate of the animal or resource
        wantY - The desired y coordinate of the animal or resource
        Returns:
        A string ArrayList containing the correct movement pattern in chronological order to reach the object

      • findResource

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findResource(int r,
                                                          int c,
                                                          Resource resource,
                                                          Animal a)
        Finds the path to the nearest desired resource and returns an ordered ArrayList of instructions to arrive there. A breadth first search (BFS) is conducted from the position of the animal until the resource is found, upon which the set of instructions is created.
        Parameters:
        r - The row of the animal
        c - The column of the animal
        resource - The resource that is desired
        a - The animal in the given position
        Returns:
        A string ArrayList containing the correct movement pattern in chronological order to reach the object

      • findAnimal

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> findAnimal(int r,
                                                        int c,
                                                        Animal animal,
                                                        Animal a)
        Finds the path to the nearest desired animal and returns an ordered ArrayList of instructions to arrive there. A breadth first search is conducted from the position of the animal until another animal is found, upon which the set of instructions is created.
        Parameters:
        r - The row of the current animal
        c - The column of the current animal
        animal - The animal that is desired
        a - The animal in the given position
        Returns:
        A string ArrayList containing the correct movement pattern in chronological order to reach the object

      • updateWeatherTemp

        public void updateWeatherTemp()
        Updates the weather and temperature if the user has not chosen to control the settings. Uses ticks to determine when to update the temperature and weather. Random numbers are used as probability to choose a type of weather.

      • advance

        public void advance()
        Sets the next generation of the landscape after all factors are considered. The changes in animal placement and conditions, as well as resources and weather impacts on the ecosystem, are all orchestrated and the new landscape replaces the original landscape. Animals must also mate and actively move with purpose.

      • updateRR

        public void updateRR(double rate)
        Sets the new rate for resource production on the landscape based on the passed parameter.
        Parameters:
        rate - The desired rate of resource creation

      • setWeather

        public void setWeather(java.lang.String w)
        Sets the weather of the landscape based on the passed parameter
        Parameters:
        w - represents the string describing the weather

      • natDisSet

        public void natDisSet(boolean nd)
        Sets whether or not landscape will have natural disasters
        Parameters:
        nd - represents whether or not natural disasters will occur

      • weather

        public java.lang.String weather()
        Returns:
        String representing landscape's current weather

      • disaster

        public boolean disaster()
        Returns:
        boolean representing if disaster is possible

      • temperature

        public int temperature()
        Returns:
        landscape's temperature

      • updateTemp

        public void updateTemp(int temp)
        Sets the new temperature of the landscape based on the passed parameter.
        Parameters:
        temp - The desired temperature of the environment
